Answer the given question. You must conduct reasoning inside <think> and </think> first every time you get new information. After reasoning, if you find you lack some knowledge, you can call a search engine by <search> query </search> and it will return the top searched results between <information> and </information>. You can search as many times as your want. If you find no further external knowledge needed, you can directly provide the answer inside <answer> and </answer>, without detailed illustrations. For example, <answer> Beijing </answer>. Question: What are the world's busiest airports by passenger traffic? List the top ten busiest airports between 2020-2024 (including 2020 and 2024). I want to know about their rank, specific location (including city, district, road), total passengers (with precision to the person) and code(IATA/ICAO). 

 Please organize the results in one Markdown table with the following column names in order: 
Year, Airport, Rank, Location, Total Passengers, Code(IATA/ICAO) 

Don't ask me any questions, just output the results according to the columns without omitting cells arbitrarily. The output format is ```markdown
{data_content}
```.?

<think>
To start answering this question, I need to find out the top ten busiest airports for each year from 2020 to 2024. Let's begin with searching.
</think>
<search>top ten busiest airports by passenger traffic 2020-2024</search>

Search query: top ten busiest airports by passenger traffic 2020-2024
Result: [Doc 1](https://www.oag.com/busiest-airports-world-2024):
Busiest Airports in the World 2024 - OAG The Busiest Airport in 2024 was Atlanta Hartsfield-Jackson International Airport (ATL) with 62.7 million seats. It also held the top spot in 2023 and 2019.

[Doc 2](https://airportscouncil.org/press_release/airports-council-releases-2024-north-american-airport-traffic-rankings/):
Airports Council Releases 2024 North American Airport Traffic ... Hartsfield-Jackson Atlanta International Airport retained its title as the busiest airport both domestically and globally, with 108.1 million ...

[Doc 3](https://www.facebook.com/groups/301761279672585/posts/569445829570794/):
Busiest airports in the world by passenger traffic - Facebook --- Rankings & Passenger Volume: 1. Hartsfield-Jackson Atlanta (USA) – 10.8 Cr 2. Dubai International (UAE) – 9.23 Cr 3. Dallas Fort ...

From these documents, it seems that the ranking of the top airports might be consistent, especially for Atlanta airport, but exact figures for years 2020-2024 are not clear yet due to limited precise data from searches. We need more specific details on yearly ranks and passenger numbers.

Let’s try refining our search to get specific yearly details.
</think>
<search>top ten busiest airports by passenger traffic 2020-2024 specific data</search>

Busiest Airports in the World - OAG Top 10 Busiest Global Airports by Seats ; Dubai International ; London Heathrow Apt ; Singapore Changi Apt ; Seoul Incheon International Airport ; Hong Kong ...

Based on these documents, there is still insufficient direct evidence to confirm exact passenger traffic volumes and rankings for each specific year within 2020-2024. Yet we can infer some consistent top-ranking airports such as Hartsfield-Jackson Atlanta, Dubai International, etc., but precise annual ranking and exact numbers remain elusive.
